ENRICHMENT PROTOCOL ID (Required): A unique ID for the protocol.
ENRICHMENT PROTOCOL NAME: A short name for the protocol.
ENRICHMENT PROTOCOL DESCRIPTION: A general description of the protocol.
PUBLICATION DOI: The publication digital object identifier (doi) for the protocol.
PROTOCOLS.IO DOI: The protocols.io digital object identifier (doi) for the protocol.
DOCUMENT FILENAME: A filename of a PDF document containing the details of the protocol.
ENRICHMENT METHOD (Required): A term that may be associated with a process-related ontology term.
ENRICHMENT METHOD ONTOLOGY ID: An ontology term identifier in the form prefix:accession.
ENRICHMENT METHOD ONTOLOGY LABEL ONTOLOG: The preferred label for the ontology term referred to in the ontology field. This may differ from the user-supplied value in the text field.
MARKERS: A list of markers used to enrich for or against certain cells.
MINIMUM SIZE SELECTED: Minimum cell or organelle size passing selection, in microns.
MAXIMUM SIZE SELECTED: Maximum cell or organelle size passing selection, in microns.

ENRICHMENT PROTOCOL ID (Required): Protocol ID should have no spaces.
ENRICHMENT METHOD (Required): For example: enzymatic dissociation; blood draw
ENRICHMENT METHOD ONTOLOGY LABEL ONTOLOG: For example: enzymatic dissociation; blood draw
MARKERS: Format as a space-delimited list of markers with +/- where + means enriched for and - means enriched against. For example: CD4+ CD8-; HLA-G+

ENRICHMENT PROTOCOL ID (Required): FILL OUT INFORMATION BELOW THIS ROW

ENRICHMENT PROTOCOL DESCRIPTION: T cell enrichment using magnetic negative selection for CD3+ T cells (MojoSort Human CD3+ T cell Isolation Kit; BioLegend), followed by a dead cell removal kit (Miltenyi Biotec), resulting in 80-90% purity.
